title: [BUG] Cannot delete experiments with deleted runs

labels.name: area/uiux
labels.description: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

labels.name: has-closing-pr
labels.description: This issue has a closing PR

body:
### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.

### MLflow version

1.27.0

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution**: Ubuntu 20.04
- **Python version**: 3.8


### Describe the problem

I am trying to delete experiments, using both the UI and the client, but I am getting the following error ``` INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE: The run 39a47c2a9df849b2b8a3b210da5478b4 must be in the 'active' state. Current state is deleted.```. This happens only with experiments that I have deleted individual runs, in fact even if I delete a single run, the experiment cannot be deleted later. What I've found is that if I restore the deleted runs, then I am able to remove the experiment.

### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

-

### Stack trace

```
INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE: The run 39a47c2a9df849b2b8a3b210da5478b4 must be in the 'active' state. Current state is deleted.
```

### Other info / logs

_No response_
